work.name: Computer Science Department, Oberlin College
work.summary: Acquired foundational skills in ROS and Gazebo for robotic simulations. Improved the product’s documentation for a better user experience with the guidance of Prof. McCarrin. Currently, researching on reinforcement learning techniques, such as DDPG, TD3, and DQN, for navigation and obstacle avoidance in a TurtleBot3 platform, where we are adding to the work of Tomas van Rietbergen from TU Delft.

volunteer.summary: The Hunger Network is a non-profit organization that provides food and linkages to other vital services for those in need. Collaborated with a team to prepare and distribute 100+  meals for individuals experiencing homelessness.

Created motion graphics for the segments of an LGBT+ NGO in Brazil (TV/Radio/Podcast/Store), added subtitles, and made videos and live stream edits for Instagram and IGTV. Developed 2 filters for donation information using Spark AR.

references.name: Professor Michael McCarrin
references.reference: Prof. McCarrin (mmccarri@oberlin.edu) is a dedicated mentor and has in robotics simulations and computer science at Oberlin College. I'm working with him on reinforcement learning techniques for navigation and obstacle avoidance in a TurtleBot3 platform.

references.name: Professor Patrick Simen
references.reference: Prof. Simen (pat.simen@oberlin.edu), a distinguished neuroscience professor at Oberlin College, played a pivotal role in guiding my research on soft robotics.

projects.name: Papa Tick
projects.summary: Papa Tick is a solar-powered tick control device developed at IFSP to combat Brazilian Spotted Fever. It uses CO₂ attraction and enhanced voltage to effectively lure and eliminate ticks, featuring a patented design to sort tick life stages. The project has a submitted patent and is awaiting further development

projects.name: Hybrid Renewable Energy System
projects.summary: This off-grid hybrid renewable energy system was designed to power Shagbark Learning Center, a multi-purpose retreat in Oberlin/OH.

projects.name: Autonomous Navigation with Deep Reinforcement Learning on TurtleBot3
projects.summary: This project aims to develop a reinforcement learning-based navigation system for the TurtleBot3 platform. We are currently researching DDPG, TD3, and DQN algorithms to improve navigation and obstacle avoidance.
